author: stsp
msg: * www/index.html
(rc-announcement): The most recent rc is rc3, not rc2.

author: rhuijben
msg: For issue #2028, #2556 (and probably a few others): Let svn_client_add*()
and the helpers it provides to other libsvn_client functions use
svn_dirent_*() and svn_uri_*() instead of svn_path_*()
This commit will fix the add part of update_tests.py 32.
(Checking out to the root of a Windows drive).
* subversion/libsvn_client/add.c
(svn_client__get_auto_props): Use svn_dirent_basename().
(add_dir_recursive): Use svn_dirent_join() and svn_dirent_local_style().
(add_parent_dirs): Use svn_dirent_dirname() and svn_dirent_local_style().
(svn_client_add4): Use svn_dirent_*() to find parents.
(path_driver_cb_func): Use svn_uri_dirname()
(add_url_parents): Use svn_uri_dirname().
(mkdir_urls): Split uris using svn_uri_split and join them with
svn_uri_join.

author: gstein
msg: Bump the working copy format from 10 to 11.
Clients expect the 'entries' file to have properly managed 'has_props'
and 'has_prop_mods' fields. These are no longer set by trunk-based
clients, so we need a bump to prevent older clients from reading 'entries'
and assuming its values are proper.
Note that trunk does not maintain 'cachable_props' and 'present_props' in
the entries file. However, the values (now) placed into those fields ("")
should be usable by older clients. But it is moot with the format bump.
As of this bump, 1.6 clients will produce an error when attempting to
access trunk-created working copies. When a trunk client opens a .svn
subdirectory for *writing*, then it will silently bump the version.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc.h:
(SVN_WC__VERSION): bump the value. add comments.
(SVN_WC__VERSION_EXPERIMENTAL): bump up to 12.
(SVN_WC__WC_NG_VERSION): bump to 12.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c:
(upgrade_sql): insert another NULL placeholder for format=11
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.c:
(upgrade_sql): insert another NULL placeholder for format=11
* subversion/tests/libsvn_wc/db-test.c:
(data_loading_sql): insert another NULL placeholder for format=11

author: hwright
msg: * subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c
(statement_keys, statements): Remove unused statements.

author: gstein
msg: Refine how we detect obstructed subdirectories.
When writing information into the parent directory about a subdirectory,
use kind=="subdir" in the database (not a presence field). We still need
the presence field because higher-level parts of svn rely on the status in
the parent directory to determine what to do with the subdir (and the
presence is used to detect add/delete/etc).
The information retrieval functions can now return "obstructed",
"obstructed_delete", or "obstructed_add". The higher levels don't do much
with this at the moment. We may find a use for the detail later.
When building the ENTRIES hash, we've also stopped inherited information
from the parent directory. The wc_db system returns full info -- there is
never a need to inherit. There is also a small tweak to avoid writing 0
into WORKING_NODE.changed_rev.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc-metadata.sql:
(): alter comments to note that we can now write "subdir" into the .kind
columns rather than .presence.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.h:
(svn_wc__db_kind_t): add a new kind that is used internally to wc_db
(svn_wc__db_status_t): add the two new obstructed statuses, and remove
the subdir status.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.c:
(word_to_kind): parse the "subdir" kind.
(kind_to_word): return the "subdir" string.
(word_to_presence): don't parse the obsolete "subdir" presence
(presence_to_word): no more subdir presence
(svn_wc__db_base_get_info): map subdir kind to a regular dir, and if we
see this in the database, then return an obstructed status.
(svn_wc__db_read_info): use the subdir kind as a better detection for
obstruction, and inform the caller when it occurs (and whether the
subdir was intended to be added or deleted or is missing from BASE).
and map the subdir kind into a regular dir.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c:
(read_entries): interpret obstructed adds/deletes as if the data was
still present. stop inheriting values from the parent entry.
(insert_base_node): use kind=="subdir" as appropriate
(insert_working_node): use kind=="subdir" as appropriate
(write_entry): make sure working_node->changed_rev is initialized
properly.
